alert.note: Alert for Canon City Vicinity, Eastern Fremont County; Northwestern Fremont County Above 8500Ft; Western, Central Fremont County Below 8500 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 8:11PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Fremont County through 845 PM MDT... At 811 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Waugh Mountain, or 19 miles northeast of Decker Burn Scar, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph, nickel size hail and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Fremont County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding.

area.areaDesc: Canon City Vicinity, Eastern Fremont County; Northwestern Fremont County Above 8500Ft; Western, Central Fremont County Below 8500 Ft
